I gave the original game "[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/36000/]Foreign Legion: Buckets of Blood[/url]" a thumbs down, but thought it could be a decent little game with a bit more effort.
This sequel doesn't see that effort having been done; It seems to wholesale reuse the weapons, character system and maps from the original game, with the only substantive addition being multiplayer.
I don't feel like there's anything new here, and it doesn't feel like an improvement over the original, which it needed to be.
It feels like it's a game made for a younger audience (under 12's ?), yet it has an 18+ rating on it, which baffles me now that I noticed it.

I'm going to put this bluntly first: This game is quite possibly Hitler's last attempt to screw with humanity.

The graphics are so bad that the intended cuteness, I assume, is completely lost and should be considered a case study for game designers who want to make a 'cutesy but gory game' - DO NOT DO IT LIKE THIS. I'm not even sure it could be categorized as a game, it's more a mental practice tool for those who are happy with everything and want to feel rage. Make no mistake, Foreign Legion: Multi Massacre can turn the mose calm valium crunching Buddhist monk into a rampaging berserker monstrosity. There is no redeemable thing about this absolute and utter piece of crap, at least a crap can be flushed down, or at worst wiped away, but this speck of worthlessness will be a taint on my steam account forever. I can't even recommend you buying this for your worst enemy, the developers might actually think that they did something good, and will aim to push out one more of these devil spawns.
